summary.Title: Project Assistant, DK - Esbjerg
summary.Presentation: Are you looking to further your career in the energy industry? Then do not hesitate to apply for this position and become our new Project Assistant!Your position<

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Are you looking to further your career in the energy industry? Then do not hesitate to apply for this position and become our new Project Assistant!

Your position

As our new Project Assistant for one of our projects, you will face a wide variety of interesting tasks and responsibilities related to supporting the project manager. You will be joining our Transitional Energies division and will report to the Project Support Manager. You will have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and take on different challenges within Semco Maritime.

At Semco Maritime safety is a core value, and in this role, you will contribute to maintaining and promoting a strong safety culture while delivering innovative solutions. Above all, your work will make a real change for the global energy sector.

Your place of work will be at our Global HQ located in Esbjerg, the hub of the Danish energy industry, right on the waterfront – views do not get any better than this. The position is full-time.

Your tasks & responsibilities

Working in our project department, you will have a broad variety of tasks mainly related to assisting the project managers and the project team, but you will also get the opportunity to take responsibility for your own tasks.

Your tasks will include but are not limited to:

  • Assisting project managers with many different Ad-Hoc tasks and administrative work.
  • Assisting with technical ad-hoc tasks in the team.
  • Assisting in various task within the team; Follow-up on planning and resources, liaison with customers across Semco internally, budget & economy, reporting etc.
  • Sparring with your project manager.
  • Management of specific sub areas within the project.
  • Supporting and adhering to health, safety, and environmental standards, in all activities




Your profile & qualifications

We expect that you hold a degree in technical design, administration, economics or similar. Experience from a similar position is an advantage but is by no means a requirement. Furthermore, you must be fluent in written and verbal English.

To succeed in this position, we imagine that you have:

  • Have a proactive, analytical, and organized approach to your assignments.
  • Are result-oriented and structured.
  • Possess strong MS Office skills, particularly in Excel.
  • Are service minded team player with a positive attitude.
  • Have great interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Knowledge of safety standards.




Welcome to Semco Maritime

At Semco Maritime, we create change. For people. For projects. And for the global energy sector. With us, you will join a community of over 2,500 of the most dedicated thinkers and doers in the energy industry who are driving real change and making their own personal mark on the global energy landscape.

While everyone knows why the energy transition is vital, we are concerned with the journey. How to get there. By providing the answers needed to make change real. Because we believe that global energy ambitions can only be realized through hard work and clever pragmatic solutions. This is what we do. This is what we invite you to participate in.

Safety is at the core of everything we do, and we are committed to protecting our people, partners, and the planet as we work towards a sustainable energy future.

So yes, working for us will change the energy sector – and may well change you too.

Care to join the movement?

Change. With us.

We conduct our interviews on an ongoing basis, so if you are interested, you must submit your application in English via the link below as soon as possible. If you have any questions do not hesitate to contact Project Support Manager, Transitional Energies, E&P Projects, Mads Kofoed Rasmussen on +45 79 16 66 89

APPLY:
https://semcomaritime.career.emply.com/ad/project-assistant/sx6edt/en

Semco Maritime is an international engineering and contracting company with 2,400 employees and 40 years of dedication rooted in both the conventional energy sector and the offshore wind industry. This puts us in a unique position to bridge today's and tomorrow’s solutions, constantly seeking clever and pragmatic ways to realise global energy ambitions. We do this through comprehensive project management across all phases of energy projects together with world-leading partners across the globe.
